comment: Interesting for a NAS. Light in color,  tast, and body. Not terrible for the price,  worth a try at $30 that I  spent would not recommend if more $.
Sweet and easy to drink with delicate aroma. A friendly introduction to Japanese whiskey
Great Japanese whiskey for the price.
This is a good entry point into Japanese whiskey. Affordable, great in highball.
A cheap Japanese whisky. Aroma and taste is simple. Nothing wrong, but I would rather go for a Johnnie Black, for they are pretty much at the same price range.
For the price, this is a fantastic smooth addition to any home bar!

With a slight aroma and an extremely mellow taste, this whiskey gose down easy straight, whereas the flavor practically disappears on rocks. As others have said, nothing wrong with the taste, sweet, with a little malt, and very slight smokey finish. I just wish there was a little more to it.

This one regularly wins Japanese whisky tastings I host. The malt, cereal, blends harmoniously with some more rich and caramel tastes. Would like to try the 5 year version. Paler than expected when the box is first opened.
I like this sweet and floral
Sweet on the nose, sweet on the palate.  Smooth caramel, apple, pear, with a nice pineapple finish.
One of our favorite scotches so far (Japanese or otherwise). Carmel and warm oak balanced with warm Maduro cigar smoke. No harsh alcohol to be found...almost a bourbon with a Ph.D
Strong oaky with intense high notes on the front end.  Subtle hazelnut and some heat.  Recommend with quality ice block or sphere.

Mmm...it has a great aroma, and a nice smoky bite to it. Sweet, smooth, and a little grainy. It's certainly young stuff, but I do believe this is a bit above average. A great alternative to the expensive Suntory line.
I think this was the one

slightly bitter at first with a weird almost fruity funk, like not too ripe apples. Add some water though and it changes completely, sweet and the nose is far more mild and light. I would recommend adding just the tiniest bit of water (one straw full) and it really helps.

After being knocked out for a while by a nasty cold, I'm finally back to tasting whisky. Still had some japanese samples, so might as well go on with them. 
  
  On the nose I get a slightly sweet...bourbon smell. Could be the barrel, but there is also a lot of corn in the smell, together with a bit of spice and some vanilla. 
  
  The taste is semi-sweet corn, vanilla, bit of burn and spice, and some barley taste...do we know the mashbill for this stuff? 
  
  Aftertaste is short and bitter. Not a bad whisky, but also not a good one. Would drink it if offered, but wouldn't go out of my way to get one. So far, japanese whisky has been kinda...disappointing. But I still got the big ones in front of me.

Edit: Rather nice with a ton of apple juice tho....
sterksmak preget av krydder først som blir mildere og søtere senere.
The aroma is alcohol and sharp chemical with undertones of crisp green apple and sweet corn.  It's best if paired with a cigar that tamps down the chemical components.
Some chocolate, light caramel, modest depth
Sweet and strong in the back of the throat. It’s a decent backup whiskey and the profile is simple enough that I like it in highballs and coffee, but it’s also decent after work for a nice sip
2nd Japanese whiskey , tried at sake Rok.
Basic Japanese Whisky.  Sweet, warm, light, and young.  Toffee and Carmel notes.
vanilla, first impression. light though. not particularly intense after ignoring the alcohol taste
Love love love. Light and toasty Marshmallows

Thin and not much depth, but very easy to drink. Very light smoke+floral combo on the aroma. Dry sweetness with vanilla and pear on the palate. Some honey appears as you move along. Super short finish makes this a sneaky fast pour.
Sweet, nice burn, smooth, needs a drop of water
basic light and sweet japanese whisky. nothing remarkable/stands out. just ok everyday whisky considering its cheap price.

Wolf and crane 
20180119
Travis on the way to De Lux
Like a scotch. Would be good for Old Fashioned.

nose: light leather, medium oak, vanilla, subtle banana

taste: hot marshmallow, grainy, licorice, hint of sherry
seems young and a tad astringent, but good green apple and brown sugar notes in the nose. taste is a bit thin
Very very light aroma, hard to distinguish notes really...Possibly faint toffee aroma. Very delicate whisky. Almost tastes like buttered bread. Not much else to say.
The aroma is delicate and soft. You can feel the ex sherry cask when you tasted at the end of your mouth. Pretty good whisky for only 3 years age . Love that!
Pretty harsh, not typical Japanese, wouldn't buy

Close to the official post but slightly different 
Cask - Japanese white oak that previously held sake
Interesting, different, and very enjoyable 
Whiskey Club- Hamlet and Ghost
Buttery palate
Sweet Granny Smith apples and oak on the nose, but very thin and a slightly unexpected alcohol burn and toffee on the tongue with a very fast finish.
Straight forward flavor, caramel, oak, sweet, easy to drink.  Caramel/ butterscotch aroma and flavor developed more as time goes
Smooth and sharp; alcoholic taste forward
More harsh alcohol than expected, would go fine in a cocktail.
Irish smelling... like straight up Jameson. Tastes super light. Like low abv. Very sweet, and slightly bready.
Light and delicate. Sweet and floral and vanilla

first nose, very alcoholy. first sip has wave of sweetness up front, a bit spicy in the throat - a burn from the alcohol. it's not a super smooth whiskey. on further drinking, i feel like i can taste the cask, a bit of charred oak taste. not my favorite, but granted - it is a young whiskey, probably around 3 or so year old. but it is pretty drinkable, just not so complex and smooth as an aged whiskey or other finer japanese whiskeys.
Smells like sake, a little fiery on the tongue, some peat, but enjoyable

So i decided to give this a try because it was a reasonably priced pour in a restaurant in Vegas. Unfortunately it was a pretty big let down, not much flavor beyond the grain that it was made with. pretty young whisky and no reason to go out and search for this one.

A sample generously gifted by bourbonjosh24. Nose: Honey sweetness with a hint of smoke and a little bit of a medicinal floral smell that I find pleasant. Background light oak and dried fruit. Flavor: Just like it smells. Lightly sweet with vanilla, light smoke, some medicinal woody smells and dried pears. Finish: Just a little spicy with a medium length finish that fades in to an oaky lightly drying pleasant taste. My favorite Japanese whisky to date. Not super complex but that allows some really nice subtle flavors to come through.
Thin, Sweet and Short...a decent sipper when you want an uncomplicated drink 😄
Sweet nose at first but immediately shifts to earthy scents including lemongrass and dirt. Palate is really yeasty with subtle moss. Finish is extremely dry and relatively short.
Smells sharp but sweet. Taste is fairly thin, a little bit of burn, but a fruity sweetness. Maybe grapes or apples. Great for the price.
Malty. Nice. Just a taster between church services

This is the first time I’ve ever experienced liking a whisky less than the first time I’ve had it. Usually it’s the other way around!

This time I’m getting a metallic scent on the nose and a lot more alcohol bite. The vanilla still comes through a bit, but not at much as I remember
